item.title: Leaning lamp post on the bridge over the A417, 19th November
item.description:
There is a lamp post which is leaning significantly to the left (visible when driving down the A417 towards junctions with the M5) on the Shurdington Road as it crosses over the A417. The lamp post is on the bridge close to the slip road onto the heading towards the junctions with the M5.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shurdington Road Junction, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Deteriorating road surface and potholes, 19th November
item.description:
The road surface just down the hill on Old Bath Road with the junction with Leckhampton Road is steadily deteriorating and there are a series of potholes in the middle of the carriageway. The position of these is such that they cannot be avoided when turning into Old Bath Road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 381, Old Bath Road, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: There was no category for this so I had to select a different one to continue, 19th November
item.description:
1. Abandoned traffic cones, probably left over from the S-T work on New Road. This is on New Road between Pottersfield and Gambles. 2. The other pic is of an abandoned diversion sign. It's on the green at the junction of New Road and Stockwell Lane

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): New Road, Woodmancote, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Environmental pollution from shops, 19th November
item.description:
Every time it is windy, the plastic waste and cardboard blows out of the bins at the back of Iceland. It then blows down the tunnel and onto the square and collect in front of the British Heart Foundation. It is time to put a stop to this Iceland have been told on several occasions And have failed to make adjustments to the waste process

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Edinburgh Place, St Mark's, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
